Details: Six people were killed and two wounded by a Boko Haram suicide attack on a mosque in the village of Zamga.[1]
A suspected Islamist stabbed two policemen with a knife near Tunisia's parliament, killing one and injuring the other.[2][3]
15 people were killed and 27 others were injured after an explosion near two tankers and a bus in the town of Charikar.[4]
Nine Iraqis were killed by the explosion of bombs left over in their homes in western Mosul by Islamic State terrorists.[5]
A suicide car bombing killed nine and injured 27 others in a government-held village in Syria's Quneitra Governorate.[6]
Three policemen were killed and three others were wounded after an Islamic State mortar attack.[7]
An Iraqi army commander was killed and four others were injured in an Islamic State bomb blast.[8]
Two citizens were killed and several others were injured when three mortar shells hit the Syrian capital.[9]
At least 100 civilians were killed and 140 others were wounded in a Daesh car bombing that struck a gathering of people displaced by fighting in eastern Syria.[10][11]
Six persons, including security personnel were killed, while six others were wounded in armed attack, bomb blasts in Mosul.[12]
At least fifteen people were killed and twenty others injured in a suicide car bombing and shooting in Aden.[13][14]
One police officer was killed and also two attackers in a shooting during a police control. One of the attackers tried to make a suicide attack but he was shot dead by the security forces.[15]
One civilian was killed plus two attackers and 21 wounded in a suicide attack in Kirkuk.[16]
Four journalists working for Russian TV channels and five Russian servicemen were injured in an explosion of an improvised explosive device planted in the Syrian city of Deir ez-Zor.[17]

A TV building was attacked in downtown Kabul by three militants. An employee and a security guard were killed while at least 20 others were injured in the attack. At least one militant blew himself up while the others were killed during a gunfight with security forces. Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.[18]
Three including a senior police official were killed in a suicide attack in Quetta .[19]
At least 23 Afghan National Police officers were killed and 15 others were wounded in a serious of attacks carried out by the Taliban on several police check posts in southern Kandahar province.[20]
Two suicide car bombings hit Aden. The motives are under investigation.[21]
Three children were killed in the explosion of a landmine, that was planted by the Islamic State group, in the city of al-Bab, in the eastern countryside of Aleppo.[22]
At least ten people have been killed and dozens injured in a suicide attack in a popular market in Maiduguri.[23][24]
Two soldiers were killed and another injured in a shooting caused by PKK members in Hakkâri Province.[25]
At least 18 people were killed including eight policemen and ten civilians in an explosive device, possibly a car bomb, outside a restaurant.[26][27]
At least 26 people were killed and dozens injured in a series of coordinated car bombings in the governorate of Deir ez-Zor, in Syria. 12 children were among the victims of this attack.[28]
A car plugged into pedestrians and injured seriously two people. Later the attacker tried to stab a police officer but he was shot and wounded.[29]
A car bombing hit a refugee camp in Idlib province killing at least 15 and wounding the same number of people.[30]
Three paramilitary personnel were killed, while five others were wounded as a booby-trapped house exploded in western Anbar.[31]
A bomb went off in a shop of construction materials in western Baghdad.[32]
At least six farmers were beheaded in Borno State, Nigeria by Boko Haram terrorists.[33]
50 people were killed in a suicide attack in the north of Nigeria caused by Boko Haram militants.[34][35]
At least 20 people were killed and dozens more injured after a suicide car bombing in Tuz Khurmatu.[36]
One person was killed and another was injured in a bomb explosion south of Baghdad.[37]

Explosions and gunfire broke out in the Georgian capital Tbilisi as counter-terrorism forces lay siege to a block of flats where suspected militants were holed up. Three attackers were killed and one arrested. One police officer was killed and two injured. Two people were also injured during the attack.[38][39]
At least eight people were killed and 15 wounded in an explosion in Jalalabad in Nangarhar province.[40]

2017 Sinai attack: According to security sources, attackers put explosives around the mosque and set fire to them when the faithful came out after Friday prayers. Then they shot at the survivors.[41][42][43][44][45]

2017 Peshawar police vehicle attack: A motorcycle suicide bomber targeted a police vehicle of AIG Asharf Noor while he was travelling to work, Asharf Noorr and his guard are killed and eight others police in the AIG's squad were injured[46][47][48]
Four United Nations peacekeepers and a Malian soldier were killed in Mali in two separate attacks.[49]
Three soldiers were killed in a grenade attack in the town of Afgoye.[50]
Three civilians were killed as a bomb went off inside a hospital in western Anbar.[51]
At least five people were killed and 26 were wounded in a suicide bomb attack targeting a security force vehicle in the city of Quetta.[52]
Two attackers opened fire at a market before one blew himself up and the other was shot dead by security forces.[53]
A grenade attack in a French military convoy injured three civilians. The attack happened just before the visit of the French President, Emmanuel Macron, in the country.[54]
At least eight people were killed, including a child, in a bomb attack in Kandahar province, Afghanistan.[55]
At least four people are killed by a car bomb targeting the Ministry of Finance in central Aden.[56]
Three children were seriously injured in a booby-trapped house explosion in Mosul.[57]
Two people including an official of Intelligence were shot dead outside a mosque in Islamabad, by several gunmen on motorbikes.[58]
A vehicle belonging to Nepali Congress parliamentary candidate Narayan Bahadur Karki for Udayapur Constituency No 2 was ambushed. Four persons including Karki were critically injured.[59]
A mortar attack was launched from the Gaza strip on an Israeli army outpost. There were no casualties in the attack. [60]
